ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
ygData.msgSnippet: they stack great with druid damage shields though :) i ve actually used it with pretty good results. Halana, 58th Shaman Tani, 41st *cheer* Bard Solusek Ro
ygData.messageBody:
they stack great with druid damage shields though :)
i've actually used it with pretty good results.

Halana, 58th Shaman
Tani, 41st *cheer* Bard
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Monday, January 29, 2001 2:50 PM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
>
>
> I've always had a problem with our damage shields actually.
> Unless you are
> being attacked by multiple mobs, which with an enchanter
> doesn't happen too
> often, the damage output of the shields is sub-par. We have
> several other
> options which produce more damage per 6 second pulse. About
> the only time
> we've used the damage shields was in multi-bard groups.
> There's almost
> always a better song to play than a damage shield, heck there probably
> always is a better song unless you're just wading thru greenies.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Monday, January 29, 2001 2:26 PM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
>
>
> I dont know if I would pick those songs (what level bard?
> depends on what
> choices were available) but they are not that far off base:
>
> Chains: good snare and atk slow down
>
> Fufil's not only does some targeted damage but it also
> reduces the mob's MR
> (if anything, lead with Fufils so next thing sticks better.)
>
> Psalm of cooling: it gets awful hot and sweaty in Lower Guk
> and the damage
> shield also helps - especially if more than on mob is awake.
>
> Just a thought,
>
> Sylly
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Matt DeBarger [mailto:mattdeba@...]
> Sent: Monday, January 29, 2001 11:12 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Soloing bards
>
>
> Heh with my cleric (who normally plays only in his regular
> group, but with
> my play I have missed several sessions and need to catch up),
> I was gfrouped
> with a monk and a bard in L Guk ("How long could it take for
> us to tfind a
> tank, lets get the ass sup camp while we wait"). The bard
> was singing the
> oddest collection of songs. Chains (good choice with no
> snarer or slower),
> Curtailing Chant (with weapons) and Pslam of Cooling. Eh????
> I suggested
> singing celerity night be more useful (though I am loathe to ever say
> anything) since the monk was dual wielding knuckledusters.
> Oddly she was
> quite competent at crowd control. With Pixie she was keeping
> 2 mobs at bay
> with no trouble...
>
>
